description: Daytime settings

name: dayautoexposure
description: Activate to enable daytime auto-exposure.
label: Auto-Exposure

name: daymaxexposure
description:
Maximum daytime Auto-Exposure time in ms (1000ms = 1 sec).
Only applies if 'Auto-Exposure' is enabled.
label: Max Auto-Exposure

name: dayexposure
description:
Daytime manual exposure time in ms (1000ms = 1 sec). Can be a fraction.
If using auto-exposure, this number is used as a starting point.
label: Manual Exposure

name: daymean
description:
The target mean brightness level when Auto-Exposure is on. Ranges from 0.0 (pure black) to 1.0 (pure white).
Best used when Auto-Exposure and Auto-Gain are on.
label: Mean Target

name: daybrightness
description:
Changes the amount of light in the image.
Low value = dark; high value = bright.
label: Brightness

name: daydelay
description: Delay between daytime images in milliseconds. 1000ms = 1 sec.
label: Delay

name: dayautogain
description: Activate to enable dayime Auto-Gain.
label: Auto-Gain

name: daymaxgain
description: Maximum gain when using Auto-Gain.
label: Max Auto-Gain

name: daygain
description:
Manually set the gain (light sensitivity).
Starts at 1. A high value returns a brighter image but more noise too.
label: Gain

name: daybin
description: Binning level. 1x1 = binning OFF.
label: Binning

name: dayawb
description: Sets Auto White Balance.
label: Auto White Balance

name: daywbr
description:
Red component for the white balance.
When using Auto White Balance, this number is a starting point.
label: Red Balance

name: daywbb
description:
Blue component for the white balance.
When using auto white balance, this number is a starting point.
label: Blue Balance

name: dayskipframes
description: When starting Allsky during the day, skip up to this many frames while the software gets to the correct exposure.
label: Frames To Skip

description: Nighttime settings

name: nightautoexposure
description: Activate to enable nighttime auto-exposure.
label: Auto-Exposure

name: nightmaxexposure
description:
Maximum nighttime Auto-Exposure time in ms (1000ms = 1 sec).
Only applies if 'Auto-Exposure' is enabled.
label: Max Auto-Exposure

name: nightexposure
description:
Manual nighttime exposure time in ms (1000ms = 1 sec).
If using auto-exposure, this number is used as a starting point.
label: Manual Exposure

name: nightmean
description:
The target mean brightness level when Auto-Exposure is on. Ranges from 0.0 (pure black) to 1.0 (pure white).
Best used when Auto-Exposure and Auto-Gain are on.
label: Mean Target

name: nightbrightness
description:
Changes the amount of light in the image.
Low value = dark; high value = bright.
label: Auto-Exposure Brightness

name: nightdelay
description: Delay between nighttime images in milliseconds (1000ms = 1 sec).
label: Delay

name: nightautogain
description: Activate to enable nighttime Auto-Gain.
label: Auto-Gain

name: nightmaxgain
description: Maximum gain when using Auto-Gain.
label: Max Auto-Gain

name: nightgain
description:
Manually set the gain (light sensitivity).
A high value returns a brighter image but more noise too.
label: Gain

name: nightbin
description: Binning level. 1x1 = binning OFF.
label: Binning

name: nightawb
description: Sets Auto White Balance.
label: Auto White Balance

name: nightwbr
description:
Red component for the white balance.
When using Auto White Balance, this number is a starting point.
label: Red Balance

name: nightwbb
description:
Blue component for the white balance.
When using auto white balance, this number is a starting point.
label: Blue Balance

name: nightskipframes
description: When starting Allsky at night, skip up to this many frames while the software gets to the correct exposure.
label: Frames To Skip

description: Both daytime and nighttime settings

name: saturation
description: -100 to 100 on Buster, 0.0 to 2.0 on Bullseye.
label: Saturation

name: gamma
description:
0 to 100. Changes the difference between light and dark areas.
A high value increases contrast. Not supported on all cameras.
label: Gamma

name: offset
description: Adds about 1/10 the specified value to every pixel to brighten everything.
label: Offset

name: awb
description: Sets Auto White Balance.
label: Auto White Balance

name: wbr
description:
Red component for the white balance.
When using Auto White Balance, this number is a starting point.
label: Red Balance

name: wbb
description:
Blue component for the white balance.
When using auto white balance, this number is a starting point.
label: Blue Balance

name: aggression
description:
How much of a calculated change should be made during auto-exposure?
Lower numbers smooth out changes but take longer to react to brightness changes.
label: Aggression

name: gaintransitiontime
description:
Number of minutes over which to increase or decrease the gain when going from day-to-night or night-to-day images.
This helps smooth brightness differences. Only works if nighttime Auto-Gain is off. 0 disables transitions.
label: Gain Transition Time

name: width
description: Image width in pixels. 0 = max sensor width.
label: Image Width

name: height
description: Image height in pixels. 0 = max sensor height.
label: Image Height

name: type
description:
Choose between auto, color (RGB24) or grayscale (RAW8 or RAW16 for mono cameras, Y8 for color cameras).
16 bits only works with PNG extension. 'auto' tries color first, then RAW16, then RAW8.
label: Image Type

name: quality
description:
Range for a PNG image: 0-9. Range for a JPG image: 0-100.
Higher numbers produce larger, clearer files.
label: Quality

name: autousb
description: Automatically set the USB bandwidth.
label: Auto USB Bandwidth

name: usb
description:
USB bandwidth. Values between 40-100.
If you get ASI_ERROR_TIMEOUT errors in the log file, try chaning this value.
label: USB Bandwidth

name: filename
description:
Extensions allowed: .jpg or .png.
WARNING: saving a .png file can take 10 or more seconds so be sure the time between successive images is long enough. To measure how long it takes your Pi to save a .png file, set the 'Debug Level' to 3 and look in the log file.
label: Filename

name: rotation
description: Set image rotation to enable proper orientation.  **NOTE**: on Bullseye only 180 is available.
label: Rotation

name: flip
description: Select a flipping option if you want to reverse the image along an axis.
label: Flip

name: notificationimages
description: Activate to display notification images, e.g., 'Camera is off during the day'.
label: Notification Images

name: coolerEnabled
description: Activate to use cooling (works only on cooled cameras).
label: Cooling

name: targetTemp
description: Sensor's target temperature when cooler is enabled (degrees Celsius).
label: Target Temp.

name: latitude
description: Latitude of the camera. Needs a number (0 to 90) and direction (N or S), for example: 60.7N.
label: Latitude

name: longitude
description: Longitude of the camera. Needs a number (0 to 180) and direction (E or W), for example: 135.05W.
label: Longitude

name: angle
description: Altitude of the Sun in degrees relative to the horizon at which to switch between day and night.
label: Angle

name: darkframe
description:
Activate to capture dark frames. This mode hides text and time overlays.
Will continually take dark frames until restarted.
label: Capture Dark Frames

name: locale
description:
Your locale, used to determine what the thousands and decimal separators are.
Type 'locale' at a command prompt to see your choices (use the LC_NUMERIC entry).
label: Locale

name: histogrambox
description: Size of the histogram box (X and Y in pixels) and offset from left and top (0-100 percent). Sizes must be even numbers.
label: Histogram Box

name: debuglevel
description: Debug level, 0 is lowest level.
label: Debug Level

name: newexposure
description: Activate to use the version 0.8 exposure method which decreases sensor temperature.  If you see ASI_ERROR_TIMEOUTs in the log file, deactivate this.
label: Version 0.8 Exposure

name: alwaysshowadvanced
description: Activate to always show the advanced options.
label: Always Show Advanced

description: Image overlay settings

name: showTime
description:
Activate to display the time on the overlay.
Combine with Text X and Text Y for placement of ALL overlay options.
label: Show Time

name: timeformat
description: Determines the format of the displayed time. Run 'man 3 strftime' to see the options.
label: Time Format

name: showTemp
description: Activate to display the camera sensor temperature on the overlay.
label: Show Temperature

name: temptype
description: Unit(s) to display temperature in.
label: Temperature Units

name: showExposure
description:
Activate to display the exposure length on the overlay.
If Auto-Exposure is set, '(auto)' will appear after the exposure time.
label: Show Exposure

name: showGain
description:
Activate to display the camera gain on the overlay.
If Auto-Gain is set, '(auto)' will appear after the gain value.
label: Show Gain

name: showBrightness
description: Activate to display the Brightness value on the overlay.
label: Show Brightness

name: showUSB
description:
Activate to display the USB Bandwidth value on the overlay.
This is mostly for testing.
label: Show USB

name: showMean
description: Activate to display the mean brightness on the overlay.
label: Show Mean Brightness

name: showhistogrambox
description: Enable to show an outline of the histogram box, useful for determining what the 'Histogram Box' numbers should be.
label: Show Histogram Box

name: showFocus
description: Activate to display a focus metric to help you focus the camera.
label: Show Focus Metric

name: text
description: Text that appears below the optional time with the same color and size.
label: Text Overlay

name: extratext
description:
Extra Text File (enter full path to the file).
Leave blank if NOT using an extra text file.
label: Extra Text File

name: extratextage
description:
The maximum age of the extra text file in seconds.
After this time the contents of the file will no longer be displayed. Set to 0 to always display.
label: Max Age Of Extra

name: textlineheight
description: The line height of the text in pixels. If increasing the font size causes the text to overlap then increase this value.
label: Line Height

name: textx
description: Text placement horizontal from LEFT in pixels.
label: Text X

name: texty
description: Text placement vertical from TOP in pixels.
label: Text Y

name: fontname
description: Font name for the text overlay. Used for both large and small text.
label: Font Name

name: fontcolor
description:
Blue, Green, and Red (BGR) values of text color. 0 to 255 for each channel.
NOTE: When using RAW 16 only the first two values are used i.e., 255 128 0.
label: Font Color

name: smallfontcolor
description:
BGR value of text color. 0 to 255 for each channel.
NOTE: When using RAW 16 only the first two values are used i.e., 255 128 0.
label: Small Font Color

name: fonttype
description: Choose between smooth font lines (antialiased), 8-pixel, or 4 pixel connectivity (harder edges).
label: Font Smoothness

name: fontsize
description: Text Font Size. The time, if displayed, will use this size; other text displayed will be about 20% smaller.
label: Font Size

name: fontline
description: Text Font Line Thickness.
label: Font Weight

name: outlinefont
description: Adds a black outline to the text overlay to improve contrast.
label: Use Outline Font

description: Allsky Map Settings

name: showonmap
description: Activate to have your camera appear on the Allsky map.
label: Show on Map

name: location
description:
The location of your camera, for example: Whitehorse, YT.
No need to enter country since it'll be obvious looking at the map.
label: Location

name: owner
description: The owner of the camera. It can be your name or an association or observatory, etc.
label: Owner

name: websiteurl
description:
The URL of your website, for example: https://www.thomasjacquin.com/allsky.
If your camera is not accessible on the Internet, leave this field empty.
Must begin with http or https.
label: Website URL

name: imageurl
description:
The URL of the image on your website, for example: https://wwww.thomasjacquin.com/allsky/image.jpg.
Right-click on the image and select Copy Image Address.
If your camera is not accessible on the Internet, leave this field empty.
Must begin with http or https.
label: Image URL

name: camera
description: The model of your camera, for example: ASI 224MC or RPiHQ.
label: Camera

name: lens
description: The lens you're using on your camera, for example: Arecont 1.55.
label: Lens

name: computer
description: The computer inside your allsky enclosure, for example: Raspberry Pi 3.
label: Computer
